2.1b: subsection b.definition: a section of a packet of data that contains information about the contents of the packet and its destination.
the actual data being carried in a data packet.
a section of a packet of data that contains information about any error checking methods that may be used.
the unique address that is given to a device when it is connected to a network.

2.1c: subsection c.definition: a method of transmitting data packets across a network. Each data packet is able to take an individual pathway across the network.

2.1d: subsection d.definition: a transmission method where data is sent one bit at a time down a single wire.
a transmission method where data is sent multiple bits at a time down multiple wires.
a transmission method where data is transmitted in a single direction only.
a transmission method where data is transmitted in both directions, but only one direction at a time.
a transmission method where data is transmitted in both directions at the same time.

2.1e: subsection e.definition: disruption, such as electromagnetism, to data when it is transmitted.
data that arrives at the destination with the bits no longer synchronised.

2.1f: subsection f.definition: an industry standard that is used to transmit data.
a socket that is a part of a device or computer that enables you to insert a USB cable.
a type of transmission media that uses the USB method to transmit data.
a collective name for using a USB cable plugged into a USB port to transfer data from one device to another.
the name of a device that plugs into a USB port on a computer.
